intro: Impatiens purpurea, commonly known as the purple touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in clusters atop slender stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soil in partial shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Impatiens purpurea is valued in gardens for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
